channel.title: [RESOLVED - DENIED] User profiles
channel.description:
I think we should make our profiles more sociable where you could upload images, write on walls, see friends etc.
^ if not something basic for a more sociable environment.

item.title: [RESOLVED - DENIED] User profiles
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“tigerclan, post:12, topic:520563”][quote author=Arcik link=topic=639060.msg4307767#msg4307767 date=1370211191]

Nah, I’m pretty sure this would just clutter up the forums and make them more complex. Just add your friends on Facebook if you want to network with them.

Not everybody is retarded. I rather keep social life away this.
[/quote]

Yeah read your own quote there dipshit[/quote]

I meant real life lol

Read full topic

item.title: [RESOLVED - DENIED] User profiles
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:6, topic:520563”][quote author=Arcik link=topic=639060.msg4307682#msg4307682 date=1370197479]

So you basically want us to use some heap of uselessness like vbulletin?

Why is it useless?
[/quote]
Why isn’t it? It’s bulky, can easily cost upwards of thousands of pounds if you want it to function how you want it, has a terrible support community, has about 9000 useless features. Need I go on?[/quote]
That is the most horrible attempt to argue against the idea. I suggest you re-think about what you’re saying first.

Kidpaparoach:

I’d say some social features should be added in, every other forum that I am active on has them; they must be a success, right? All of the other forums apart from r-s aren’t programming related intentionally though I guess.

A social feature is the aim even if it’s up most basic. Interacting with people rather then using threads or private messaging with some coolios added

Read full topic

item.title: [RESOLVED - DENIED] User profiles
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

I’m not sure I agree with all of the features although as a whole I believe it could be a good set of features added in.

I’d say some social features should be added in, every other forum that I am active on has them; they must be a success, right? All of the other forums apart from r-s aren’t programming related intentionally though I guess.

[quote=“Ruby, post:6, topic:520563”][quote author=Arcik link=topic=639060.msg4307682#msg4307682 date=1370197479]

So you basically want us to use some heap of uselessness like vbulletin?

Why is it useless?
[/quote]
Why isn’t it? It’s bulky, can easily cost upwards of thousands of pounds if you want it to function how you want it, has a terrible support community, has about 9000 useless features. Need I go on?[/quote]
That doesn’t make it useless, just because you don’t like it doesn’t mean it’s useless. All it means based on your post is the cost may be excessive and the functions may be complex and less efficient.
As a user of vB (as in I don’t own it but use it on some forums I go on) I think vBs pretty nice. Are you going to tell me I’m wrong for thinking it’s nice?

Also, nobody said it has to be vB lol.

Personally if this were to happen which I doubt, I’d like some social mods but not all of the ones I’m assuming the OP wants however I don’t see a huge issue with excessive mods.

Read full topic
